title-part.text: DESIGN OR LAYOUT OF COURTS, RINKS OR THE LIKE

note.note-paragraph:
The following IPC groups are not in the CPC scheme. The subject matter for these IPC groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
A63C5/14 covered by A63C5/12
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

reference.text: roller skates or skate boards A63C17/00

title-part.text: rigidly mounted on the sole of the boot
with sole and heel plates each equipped with clamps
with simultaneously-tightened sole and heel clamps
tightened by the movement of the foot
tightened by lateral swinging or shifting of the blade or of the whole skate
Special structure of the clamp fastening devices
with fastening means on special metal parts
with special foot-plates of the boot
divided into two parts permitting adjustment to the size of the foot

CPC-specific-text.text: removably fastened to the blade holder
Ice wheels

title-part.text: Special constructions of the simple blade
manufactured of one piece of material
Supporting frames or gliders for skaters
Supports for use whilst strapping skates on to boots
Special spikes for the blades of skates
Accessories therefor encompasses groups A63C5/00 – A63C11/265 only.

reference.text: sledges with runners, e.g. ski-bobs, B62B13/00; runners for sledges B62B17/02; runners for carrying wheeled vehicles to facilitate travel on snow or ice B62B19/00

note.note-paragraph:
Group A63C5/00 is impacted by reclassification into group A63C5/025.
Groups A63C5/00 and A63C5/025 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

CPC-specific-text.text: Structure, covering or decoration of the upper ski surface
Appearance of the ski-tip, the rear end or the upper ski-edge

note.note-paragraph:
Group A63C5/02 is impacted by reclassification into group A63C5/025.
Groups A63C5/02 and A63C5/025 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Group A63C5/025 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from groups A63C5/00 and A63C5/02.
Groups A63C5/00, A63C5/02 and A63C5/025 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

CPC-specific-text.text: Snow-ski boards with two or more runners or skis connected together by a rider-supporting platform
Devices for enabling the use of a normal ski as mono-ski, e.g. platforms fixed on the ski for supporting the ski boots side-by-side

title-part.text: with ground engaging rolls or belts

CPC-specific-text.text: Shape thereof when projected on a plane, e.g. sidecut, camber, rocker
asymmetric
with fins or longitudinal protrusions on the running sole
Longitudinal guiding grooves
Other in-relief running soles
of the side walls
Complementary or supplementary ski edges

title-part.text: of the tips or rear ends
with special devices thereon, e.g. steering devices

CPC-specific-text.text: Ski-boot sole-scrapers
Protection or reinforcement devices for the ski-tip or the ski rear end
Rolling or like devices
apparatus for towing skis A63C11/10
with rolling or like devices

title-part.text: combined with sails or the like

CPC-specific-text.text: ; Accessories specially adapted for sail-skiing

note.note-paragraph: When classifying in this group, details of sail or rigging arrangements which are suited for marine wind propulsion are also classified in the relevant groups of subclass B63H, e.g. in groups B63H8/00, B63H9/04.

Group A63C5/11 is impacted by reclassification into groups B63H8/00 - B63H8/70 and B63H9/04 - B63H9/072.
All groups listed in this Warning should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

reference.text: materials for the running sole A63C5/056

A part for the binding being integrated within the board structure, e.g. plate, rail, insert

title-part.text: Stoppage blades attachable to the skis in such manner that these blades are permanently in the operative position
Hinged stoppage blades attachable to the skis in such manner that these blades can be moved out of the operative position

note.note-paragraph:
Group A63C11/222 is impacted by reclassification into groups A63C11/2224 and A63C11/2228.
Groups A63C11/222, A63C11/2224 and A63C11/2228 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Groups A63C11/222 and A63C11/2224 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: Devices for use in mounting ski-bindings to skis, e.g. jigs;

CPC-specific-text.text: Testing or measuring devices specially adapted therefor

Bindings therefor

Frames therefor

Accessories

Covers; Guards
Roller skates used otherwise than standing or sitting on them, e.g. body skates
with a castor wheel, i.e. a swiveling follow-up wheel
with auxiliary wheels not contacting the riding surface during steady riding
with shock absorption or suspension system
with foot plate quick release or shoe binding
with wheels of different size or type
with inclined wheel, i.e. not perpendicular to the surface it rolls on
with offset wheel, i.e. wheel contact point to surface offset from other associated wheel
with retractable wheel, i.e. movable relative to the chassis out of contact from surface
Roller skates adjustable in length to fit the size of the foot
Mechanisms transforming leaning into steering through an inclined geometrical axis, e.g. truck
rolling devices on skis A63C5/035
with steering mechanisms
with a truck, i.e. with steering mechanism comprising an inclined geometrical axis to convert lateral tilting of the board in steering of the wheel axis

with wheels arranged in two pairs
with wheels arranged in one track
Production or mounting thereof

title-part.text: Removable protective covers for courts, rinks, or game pitches or the like
Use of skates, skis, roller-skates, snowboards and courts
